isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - TWO-SPEED AXLE (AIR OPERATED)

svcproc.title: TWO-SPEED AXLE (AIR OPERATED)
svcproc.para: The two-speed axle system uses spare output #1. This includes using spare input circuits, special function relay #1 (SF-1) and special output #1. With the Allison WT transmission, there are four major components in the two-speed axle control system:

step1.para: Special function relay #1 (SF-1) located in the VIM.
The air solenoid to shift the two-speed axle.

svcproc.para: The electrical operation of the two-speed control system is as follows:

step1.para: With the key ON, accessory voltage from F14 fuse is applied to the SF-1 relay terminal 30. Also, ignition voltage from the IGN fuse (located in the VIM) is applied to SF-1 terminal 85.

With the two-speed shift switch in the HI position, the ECU ground switch is open (SF-4 relay not energized), and power from F14 fuse passes through the relay (terminal 30 to terminal 87A) to the axle solenoid, causing it to energize and apply air to the two-speed shifter. The axle will shift to high speed mode of operation.
With the two-speed shift switch in the LO position, three events occur:

step2.para: The two-speed switch is a spare input switch to the WT ECU. With the switch in the LO position, the circuit between ECU terminals B19 and B27 is closed. This communicates to the ECU that the driver wants low axle range operation.

When the ECU determines that throttle position and transmission output speed are low, the WT ECU closes a ground switch, grounding circuit 114 from SF-1 relay terminal 85. This energizes SF-1 relay, and removes power from the axle solenoid. The axle solenoid, with power removed, closes and the shifter is in the low range position.

With SF-1 relay energized, 12 volts from SF-1 relay terminal 87 is delivered (circuit 93A) to the speedometer cluster connector 27-13. Applying 12 volts to instrument cluster at connector 27-13 causes the speedometer reading to adjust for the lower axle ratio.
